resources.string: Answer yes or no to each of the following questions.
Have you not been getting things done at work or school?
Have you been withdrawn from close family and friends?
Have you been relying on alcohol and sedatives?
Have you been unable to concentrate?
Have you thought that you are a failure?
Have you stopped doing things you enjoy?
Have you thought that something is your fault?
Have you thought that nothing good ever happens to you?
Have you thought that you are worthless?
Have thought that life is not worth living?
Have you been feeling unhappy or depressed?
Have been feeling a lack of confidence?
Are you tired all the time?
Are you sick and run down?
Are you getting headaches and muscle pains?
Are you experiencing a churning gut?
Are you not able to sleep?
Are you experience a poor appetite or weight loss?
For each item decide if it: NEVER applies to you, SOMETIMES applies to you, HALF THE TIME applies to you, FREQUENTLY applies to you, ALWAYS applies to you.
1. I feel tense, nerves, restless, or agitated
2. I feel afraid for no apparent reason
3. I worry about bad things that might happen to me or those I care about.
10. I wish I could be as relaxed with myself as others seem to be.
9. From time to time I have experienced a racing heartbeat, cold hands or feet, dry mouth, sweating, tight muscles, difficulty breathing, numbness, frequent urination, or hold/cold flashes.
8. I would say I am anxious much of the time.
7. I have difficulty with my concentration, memory or thinking
6. I wish I knew a way to make myself more relaxed.
5. I have difficulty eating too much, too little or digesting my food.
4. I have difficulty falling asleep, staying asleep or waking up early
Please identify the experience that troubles you most and answer the questions in relation to this experience.

Below are a number of problems that people sometimes report in response to traumatic or stressful life events. Please reach each item carefully, then select how much you have been bothered by that problem in the past month.
Having upsetting dreams that replay part of the experience or are related to the experience?
Having powerful images or memories that sometimes come into your mind in which you feel the experience is happening again in the here and now?
Avoiding internal reminders of the experience (for example, thoughts, feelings, or physical sensations)?
Avoiding external reminders of the experience (for example, people, places, conversations, objects, activities, or situations)?
In the past month have the above problems:
Affected your relationships or social life?
Affected your work or ability to work?
Affected any other important part of your life such as parenting, or school or college work, or other important activities?
